body: There is a lot of stuff in here that has nothing to do with the flexbox module.  Is that because your stuff directly contradicted with #6126?
There's only one commit from @jdfreder, so I think it's just not based on master. Should be fixed by a rebase.

There are a lot of other properties of flexbox containers and children that would be good to support. See http://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/ for a summary.  If we're going to embrace flexbox, we might as well do it whole-heartedly :).

> There's only one commit from @jdfreder, so I think it's just not based on master. Should be fixed by a rebase.

I think @minrk is right.  I've somehow screwed the base up, I'll just rebase it.

> There are a lot of other properties of flexbox containers and children that would be good to support. See http://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/a-guide-to-flexbox/ for a summary. If we're going to embrace flexbox, we might as well do it whole-heartedly :).

I think that's a good idea, I'll add some more classes and report back.

> There are a lot of other properties of flexbox containers and children that would be good to support.

I'm reluctant to add anything more than `stretch` and `baseline`.  I already have a hard enough time trying to maintain backwards compatibility with the old flex box implementations (for older browsers) - see the `flexbox.less` file which borrows heavily from http://infrequently.org/2009/08/css-3-progress/ .

Thanks for doing what you can!  I understand that supporting 'old' browsers is a pain.  (In the sage cell project, we've been supporting 'old' browsers for a while now with sockjs, whereas you guys drew the line and said, "You shall not pass!" with browsers that didn't support websockets :).

What about shorter names like `VBox` and `HBox`?

## 

Brian E. Granger
Cal Poly State University, San Luis Obispo
@ellisonbg on Twitter and GitHub
bgranger@calpoly.edu and ellisonbg@gmail.com

> What about shorter names like `VBox` and `HBox`?

I hesitated making it that short since every other widget  that comes with IPython is suffixed with `Widget`.  However, I did shorten it to `VBoxWidget` and `HBoxWidget`.  If we decide to use `VBox` and `HBox`, I think every widget should be renamed..  i.e. `IntSliderWidget` should be `IntSlider`.

After using the widgets now, I think the names are overly verbose.  If it was important to have the "widget", then it's easy enough to just do:

``` python
from IPython.html import widgets
widgets.IntSlider
```

and the like.
Good point, I'll bring this up during the Dev meeting tomorrow.

I agree, great point Jason!

I'm :+1: on dropping the word Widget from all of the classes in the widgets submodule
If we are going for renaming changes, we might also change the filenames to not be widget_*, and instead be just *.

> If we are going for renaming changes, we might also change the filenames to not be widget_*, and instead be just *.

I tried doing that the first time around, but that gave me names like `bool.py` and `int.py` which conflicted with the int and bool types in Python.  It was ugly :cactus: .
@jdfreder: fair enough.  The file names don't matter to me very much because I don't actually type them out every day.
I cherry-picked @SylvainCorlay's commit into here and made vbox and hbox helper functions.  Waiting to see what Travis thinks...
This passes including the name deprecation, ready for further review.
I just saw it, it looks good :) .  Why do you think it should be merged into this PR instead of being a PR on it's own?
@jdfreder  Just because it (slightly) conflicts with it. Although the conflict is easy to resolve.
- add stuff in whatsnew incompat-\* and say that deprecated widget things will be remove in version 4.0.

This is ready for further discussion/review and/or merging.

Edit: Except it needs a rebase...
What about creating backward compatibility classes (or functions) corresponding with the old names of the widgets? It could print a deprecation message, so that people start smoothly switching.

> What about creating backward compatibility classes (or functions) corresponding with the old names of the widgets? It could print a deprecation message, so that people start smoothly switching.

That's already what it does in things like : 

```
+# Remove in IPython 4.0
+CheckboxWidget = DeprecatedClass(Checkbox, 'CheckboxWidget')
+ToggleButtonWidget = DeprecatedClass(ToggleButton, 'ToggleButtonWidget')
```
My bad, I missed it. Thanks.
@ellisonbg did you say you wanted to review this before it was merged?
Rebased

From HipChat discussion with Brian:
- s/Container/Box everywhere
Let's wait for Travis to finish, but the changes look good.
Comments addressed
